page.title: 10DEIGHTON CLOSE SCH.ELKINGTON
page.content: The compulsion by law for schooling causes delinquency in a minority of children,while others query the validity of main stream schooling.In old days such children were punished by imprisonment,even transported,but now they are cared for and educated in the best possible manner.Deighton Close Special School was opened in 1967 for 56 boys who had difficulty fitting into ordinary schools.The Victorian house was bought by the Lincolnshire County Council in 1964, and adapted and added to between 1965 and 1975 with staff houses,boarding houses and a large teaching block. It stands in over 3 acres of parkland and woods on the border with Louth.The skilful blending of old with the new has resulted in a Civic Trust Award.
